intro: Trieenea lasiocephala, commonly known as the woolly-headed tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to yellow. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, facilitating its dispersal by wind or animals.
